rename.from: [bug] Got an error using naive-ui after upgrade to rc.1
rename.to: [bug] Uncaught TypeError: Cannot assign to read only property 'toString' of object '#<Object>'

body:
The same error is happening in a blank Angular Tauri app created with `npx create-tauri-app`.

```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot assign to read only property 'toString' of object '#<Object>'
```

It's triggered by this line (this is inside Angular's zone.js):
```js
Object.prototype.toString = function () {
  //...
}
```

The error is happening on both Windows and macOS with the release candidate of Tauri (haven't tested linux). But it is not happening in Tauri beta and not in the browser (Edge nor Safari).

issue.title: [bug] Typescript + styled-components breaks app

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug I was recently trying to upgrade from 1.0.0-beta.8 to 1.0.0-rc.0. However, I was running into lots of errors. I've narrowed down a reproducible error with using styled-components and typescript in a React project. I tried my best to diagnose through styled-components, but the app works in the browser, just not a local Tauri app. The app was working in its entirety with 1.0.0-beta.8, but I'm not sure in which update this breaking change happened. ### Reproduction 1. Create a new Tauri app using create-react-app - `yarn create tauri-app` - Press any key to continue - Pick any app name, or leave default (tauri-app) - Pick any window title, or leave default (Tauri App) - UI Recipe: choose `create-react-app` - Add `"@tauri-apps/api"` npm package - Use __Typescript__ create-react-app template - Choose version `1.0.0-rc.0` for "@tauri-apps/cli` 2. Install styled-components for typescript - `yarn add styled-components @types/styled-components` 3. Create a styled component in App.tsx ``` ... import styled from 'styled-components' const Title = styled.h1` color: green; `; ...

Edit src/App.tsx and save to reload.

Styled h1 ... ``` 4. Run app `yarn tauri dev` 5. App is blank screen, but you can see it in a browser at `http://localhost:3000` ### Expected behavior Tauri app window is not a blank screen. Should look like the browser view if you navigate to `http://localhost:3000` ### Platform and versions ```shell $ tauri info Operating System - Windows, version 10.0.19042 X64 Webview2 - 98.0.1108.43 Visual Studio Build Tools: - Visual Studio Build Tools 2019 Node.js environment Node.js - 17.3.1 @tauri-apps/cli - 1.0.0-rc.0 @tauri-apps/api - 1.0.0-rc.0 Global packages npm - 8.3.0 pnpm - 6.11.0 yarn - 1.22.15 Rust environment rustc - 1.58.1 cargo - 1.58.0 Rust environment rustup - 1.24.3 rustc - 1.58.1 cargo - 1.58.0 toolchain - stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc App directory structure /.git /node_modules /public /src /src-tauri App tauri.rs - 1.0.0-rc.0 build-type - bundle CSP - default-src 'self' distDir - ../build devPath - http://localhost:3000/ framework - React ``` ### Stack trace ```shell Uncaught TypeError: Cannot assign to read only property 'toString' of object '#' at Sheet.js:122:1 at Module../node_modules/styled-components/dist/styled-components.browser.esm.js (Sheet.js:127:1) at Module.options.factory (react refresh:6:1) at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:24:1) at fn (hot module replacement:61:1) at Module../src/App.tsx (wordmark.svg:29:1) at Module.options.factory (react refresh:6:1) at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:24:1) at fn (hot module replacement:61:1) at Module../src/index.tsx (App.tsx:46:1) ``` ### Additional context I see that this is probably an issue with styled-components, but as I can only get the issue when running a Tauri app, I felt it best to bring the issue here in case the problem occurs with one of Tauri's dependencies

body:
I have the same issue with mobx library
it did not happen in beta version, started happening with release candidate
tested on windows and linux

By default we're freezing the prototype. You can set `tauri.conf.json > security > freezePrototype` to false to fix this problem. Note that you should freeze the prototype later if possible. Documentation on this will be updated soon.
We're going to publish a new release changing the default value to false since this breaks on several frameworks.

issue.title: [bug] Pixi.js in Svelte stopped to work after upgrading the application to RC

labels.name: status: invalid
labels.description: This is not a valid issue

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug I was playing with Tauri & Pixi.js for some time in beta 8. Everything was just fine. But after Tauri updated to RC Pixi.js doesn't work anymore. I tried it in updated to RC project as well as in the newly created one. The problem is only in Tauri. Running the same application in the browser works. Tauri application starts(`npm run tauri dev`) with the white screen and an error in the logs And it happens within pixi.js library Meanwhile if I run the app in the browser using `npm run dev` it is working just fine. ### Reproduction Create an empty application using Svelte template ``` npx create-tauri-app ``` Install pixi.js ``` npm i pixi.js ``` Disable `preferBuiltins` in the rollup config ```json resolve({ browser: true, dedupe: ["svelte"], preferBuiltins: false, }), ``` Add the following code to `App.svelte` ```svelte
``` ### Expected behavior The application runs the same in browser and in Tauri ### Platform and versions ```shell âžœ test-pixi npm run tauri info > test-pixi@1.0.0 tauri > tauri "info" Operating System - Mac OS, version 11.6.0 X64 Node.js environment Node.js - 16.14.0 @tauri-apps/cli - 1.0.0-rc.2 @tauri-apps/api - 1.0.0-rc.0 Global packages npm - 8.3.1 pnpm - Not installed yarn - 1.22.17 Rust environment rustc - 1.58.1 cargo - 1.58.0 Rust environment rustup - 1.24.3 rustc - 1.58.1 cargo - 1.58.0 toolchain - stable-x86_64-apple-darwin App directory structure /node_modules /public /src-tauri /.vscode /src App tauri.rs - 1.0.0-rc.1 build-type - bundle CSP - default-src 'self' distDir - ../public devPath - http://localhost:8080/ framework - Svelte bundler - Rollup ``` ``` ### Stack trace ``` [Error] TypeError: Attempted to assign to readonly property. (anonymous function) (bundle.js:5967) (anonymous function) (bundle.js:5971) Global Code (bundle.js:41687) ``` ### Additional context _No response_

issue.title: [bug] Some kind of regression between commit 9bb689 and v1.0.0-rc.1 in webview

labels.name: status: invalid
labels.description: This is not a valid issue

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

There has been some kind of regression between commit 9bb689 and v1.0.0-rc.1 in the webview. 

Previously my application was able to build and load the webview just fine, however, now I seem to be getting an error in the webview: `TypeError: Attempted to assign to readonly value`. This occurs specifically with my `dayjs` and `lodash` dependencies.

I am not sure how to go about debugging this, let me know what info you need.

body:
> By default we're freezing the prototype. You can set `tauri.conf.json > security > freezePrototype` to false to fix this problem. Note that you should freeze the prototype later if possible. Documentation on this will be updated soon.

How about adding a config item like `devFreezePrototype` (like `devCsp` to `csp`) that only applies on dev? The `freezePrototype` seems to only cause this bug when running a dev server, but not affecting the bundled release version.
